entry.title: MATH410 - Fundamental Concepts of Mordern Algebra
entry.content:
Basic Info

Instructor: Professor Henry Tucker.
Textbook: Algebra by Michael Artin (Classic version).
Topics: some review of linear algebra, groups, groups action, group representation (so far).
Note: It’s my first attempt to type lecture notes in LaTex sychronously with the help of vimTex and Snippets.

Class Documents

Notes I: This lecture note (here), covering everything before the first midterm, includes a quick review of vector space and linear algebra, then follows the structure of Artin’s Chapter 2 from groups and subgroups to quotient group.
Notes II: When talking about group operations, the lecture doesn’t use the original order in Artin’s textbook. So plz only use Artin’s as a reference (wiki is also a good reference for these fundamental group concepts). The lecture notes for second midterm here is still in editing.
Homework: Here. Though still in editing.
